Blog.post: I'm moving the site to a .com shortly ...in the next few days so...as i can add pictures and easly up loaf recipies and such - posted by christopher

Man, once I get settled in at Iowa, and if I have any spare time (if all goes according to my evil plan I will) I'll be starting up the Iowa City extension of North Shore Brewery. Of course, there aren't really any shores around there, except for the Coralville Reservoir, but that's alright. I know a bunch of people out there already who like a good beer, or many good beers, and could probably very easily be convinced to join in the brewing. In fact, the first drink I had when I went out to visit was a home-brew, and pretty good too, although I didn't the fine artisan who concocted it. It was still not as good as the NSB chocolate stout, or the Smashing Pumpkin Ale that I loved so well, but it was good. We need to get together and make some POWER-LLAGER, or possibly PILSNER-LLOYD. Perhaps when this whole stupid college thing blows over, and all of us (me, Chris, Mark, Pete and Noah) live together and have a rockin' band, which would be even more amazing than the Traveling Wilburys for its amalgamation of rock geniuses, and me. Well, now I've strayed from the topic of beer, the first of many more to do so on this blog, I'm sure. But of course, beer and rock are inseparable, like strands of thread that intertwine to form a rope, a rope that binds us all together, even though we are distant geographically. Wow, that was deep. I need a beer. - posted by jason
Fucking ad's "Drink and be hoppy"

chris this is a novel idea!!!! we must grow hops out side of the murder shed at the entrance or something. well i started my beaux brew (strawberry blonde) man it was vomiting up so much and after transfer i was left with only about 3 gallons but it seems it will be a solidly great beer. anyway i had a brilliant idea.. we should brew a beer almost entirely on the beach for a super summer ale or something. so wow the electric and water actually works in the murder shed!!! Wow well anyway love ya guys peace mark

Well then i was bored again and i thought that this summer should be the beginning of northshore brewery's renaissance...starting with the no sham sham rock red i was supposed to brew almost ..well probly a month ago and now that im moving into my own place the home brewing will be often and often excellent i'm inviting anyone who wants to brew to join me any time and if anyone has good recipies they would like to share....im saving some smashing pumpkin ale for noah and peter...you uys have to visit the brewery soon...the brewing will take place in the new murder shed ..it has a stove and running water soo itll be sweet. Our own little brewery is moving out of the basments!
i need to bottle but ive just had too much stupidiy going on and not enough empty bottles
the red is in secondary...soon my pretty
The Shamrock red is in primary fermantation - i did not all grain it i used liquid malt and grains....its got a good color already it should be a good brew. - posted by christopher

chris you got all the equipment for allgrain brewing? if so sweet then maybe this summer we can do some all grain brews and save some cash oh yeah sarah talked her father in to starting up brewing again since he is retiring he used to brew but then the wife was complaining tomuch but sarah convinced him and he went out and bought new Equipment .... sweet huh? hopefully we'll be sharing resipes and stuff anywho hope the red goes well peace oh yeah so our vending machines dont have root beer so i desided to ask on of the vending guys and he said he didnt do drinks but if i leave a message on the machine they should be able to stock it so here is the letter i left: Could you please stock one of our machines with Root Beer? Root beer is a traditional beverage which has been enjoyed for many, many years and in recent times me and my fellow colleagues have been noticing the decline in popularity of this traditional beverage. We at NCSA (school of design and production) like to hold on to our traditional roots hence this humble request. Thank you greatly - School of design and production posted by mark
Tomorrow i will be brewing....Shamrock red ...i should have brewed it in march but i drank too much -posted by christopher

so the honey lager is in the secondary...smells great beautifull aroma....sticky carboys the shamrock red was a sham...a little too bitter eh well see what happens in a week or so so big 4th of july blowout N.S.B. with rock music...the wayback machine (me) jon kaplan, vulpine penhas trashed on fiction and closed at sunset oh and noah who the fuck am i kidding no-one reads this shit anyway

me and mark brewed some mead (or honey wine)and then we brewed some honey lager, it was a theme brewing day..we also drank some previous home brew as per the 1st rule of homebrewing....last night the honey lager started to spit up but eh it was taken care of in total we used 18 lbs of honey "it smells like beee in here!"

the honey lager was pretty good though not my favorite of our brews...the crazy belgium dark will be unvieled on sat aug7th keg party call me for directions 516-458-2345 the "my black ass porter" should be ready in a few weeks dark ass porter not much beats it hope to see y'all tommarow oh and the sham red was awesome after it was aged, but alas there is no more

this summer DEF LEPPARD is playing at jones beach - all must attend it is mandatory . for god sakes the drummer only has one arm i cant wait,(i just hope they dont have the un band open for them again). i'm so stoked. this will be a rock and roll summer that will put corey feldman to shame.

a yellow tie, for god sakes i'm wearing a yellow tie. what have i become? bo fuckin didly is playing 3 walking minuites from my house, bo didly is awesome. i didnt know he was still around but i "garounteeee" i will be there. rock

hello....there is a few few things coming up for the end of spring and the summer first off we have power-lloyd back in full force and ready to rock you like a mother fuckin hurricane we will be playing in central park, jason mr. bollters and the rest. all are welcome to come. second i have to give mad props to jason for graduating this year i'm sooo proud. hoover ball im sure everyone has heard me talk about this time and time again we will probably be playing at cedar or wading river beaches ( the only two places i know that have nets set up). two trips that i want to start planning the first a day trip or weekend for maybee june or july to hershey park (i love the ride through the choclate factory and the little sample they give you on the way out and ooohhhh the fudge the fudge i say!!!). the second trip is a little further than that i want to plan a cruise for new years eve im telling people now because its kind of expencive and i like to give every one time to save up whoever wants to go think about what a great fuckin party that will be. well alright ...... b> urlLink urlLink

I've been trying to post (i think thats the right word) links to two sights but im an idiot so for now ill just type the page url thingy www.realultimatepower.net - this sight is all about ninjas www.magikeye@scamptabulous.us - this is noahs sight he' got funnie pictures or something im going to try playing some more but for now ..........

Lost in his own museum ummmm....hey every one this is my new umm..blog well actualy my first blog anyway so im going to be brief...maybe. forgive any spelling or grammer mistakes because i really dont care about that shit. also im not very computer freindly so if things dont come out right ... too fuckin bad. i decided to start this blog this afternoon because i was talking to jay about johnny cash's new album its totally fuckin sweet he does a lot of covers that are incedable " hurt " (originaly by nin) watch the video you'll want to but him a double shot of wiskey. he does " bridge over troubled water" i was never a big simon and garfunkle ( iknow thats spelt wrong shut up!) fan but wow fucing wow. he also does a sick cover of "personal jesus" with john fruchante from the chilli pepers awesome just awesome. even though there is snow on the ground me and jay declared "bitchin summer" (see summer of '97) for those of you who are fans of power-lloyd your in fucking luck its almost summer that means reunion time thats right break out your your weasel balls and we maybe seeing lil' petey joining the group on trumpet or hemp neclace, whatever he wants to play. so im going to bed its 3 minutes past ten way past my bed time on a skool night. oh one more thing check out noahs web sight he has a bunch of good tunes he wrote as well as an awesome cover of i'll remember you plus he has bocoach stuff on there. well thanks for reading my rant peace out.

i dont have anything to say but i felt i should post someting any way. jay graduated last friday from mu, cum loud-eh (sorry) with honors. there were a few awesome bbqs in honor of this, singal malt scotch smoked steaks,chicken and all sorts of good food 4 days of drunken road trip - awesome. here are two albums ya all should check out (if you havent heard them already) Cursive's the ugly organ and Johhny cash's live at fulsom prison. rock

So I've decided my search for the perfect girl is over. the other day i relized i dont need the girl next door (or any girl for that matter) to make me happy. all i need is a toothbrush and a bar of soap. I am free.

I went back to borders last night and talked to that girl again. she told me the book iwas buying was great (Fight Club) and did it have anything to do with my black eye. i told her the story about peter using me as a punching bag and that we watched the movie one too many times. she said i would love it (and i did,read it all last night) and another book by the same author "choke". so after all this discussion instead of asking to buy her some coffee or something so we can further this conversation i say thank u, goodnight and walk away. SON OF A BITCH! ahhhh... help I finnaly saw identity. i have to say not cusaks best film, maybe i would have been better off seeing the lizzie maguire movie.

The first rule of Fight Club is you do not talk about Fight Club while drunk . you will get a black eye. lil' petey, skulltise and me were drunk at eds house and peter punched me in the eye while i was eating terriaki beef jerky, it was really pretty funny (not as funny as noahs last blog entry, although no matter how drunk i am i wont go near poo). other funny things have happened as a direct result of watching fight club the first was the first time i saw it mark was drunk on my couch and couldnt get up to move his car blocking jays so i decided "hey i can drive stick" ( ididnt know the first thing about driving stick) i rumage through marks poket, his keys and electric tape fall out and what does he reach for?.... his electrical tape and then he howls and mutters something about rugby chicks (well rugby chick, that was a diffrent story). i go out to marks car get it started stall about 4 times and cant get it into reverse so jays trying to help sticks his head in the door just as i hit the gas and smack the door hits his face. the other funny thing is a skulltise story he tried to start his own fight club behind the skool and it was broken up by a bunch of bike cops with little bicycle shorts because some kid told his mommy(see the first rule of fight club!). skulltise ha ha ha " these are most deadly scorpians ive ever seen"

Noah informed me that i should have comments on my page, however what he doesnt know is that i've tried and failed misrabley so if you would like to comment [untill i unfuck myself anyway (this a term they used in basic trianing when you srew up. "prive" they would say "you better unfuck your self)] so e-mail me for now cgrantirish@aol.com. oh well.

So im at borders the other day (umm..yesterday) and im paying for this really nice hard cover copy of "slaughterhouse five". the cashier was this totally cute girl must have been about 20, strawberry blond, shoulder lenght hair and blue/green eyes, perfect for me(am i shallow?). so we talk for about 15 miniutes about vonnegut and hard cover verses soft cover (i like hard cover so did she) and kosinsky. it was probably the best and most intellegent conversation ive had with a girl in over a year(probably since high skool)...but i totally wussed out what the hell i used to be sooo smooth and able to ask girls out and stuff, what happend ? well i need work i guess ive been out of the game for too long i need practice but.....well aahck. i was looking at the paper yesterday and i noticed that the lizzie maguire movie beat out the new john cusak and ray liotta (im not sure i spelt liotta correctly) movie. who would want to go see "lizzie maguire" rather than "identity" well she is kinda cute.......iguess i just answered my own question, dammit! why do i have to be such a dirty old man.

I'm setting up a benifit concert for breast cancer awareness. It will be at the end of august probibly the 22nd at the rocky point vfw ( dont quote me on that ). if any one wants to know more aboot it or wants to play let me know via e-mail cgrantirish@aol.com rock!

I was thinking about getting a mountin bike. I was thinking about going to key west. it sounds good to me maybee disapear in september and stay that way untill next spring. grow my hair, a beard. yeah that sounds good just me, a back pack and a tent. i think it beats working 7am - 6pm daily or checking myself into a mental institution. On the other hand maybee i should start going to sexaholics meetings to pick up chicks....or maybee i read too much
Trunk monkey, all i have to say is trunk monkey.

yeah i heard something really stupid this morning on the radio, there is a plan to make a film version of the brodway musical "hairspray".........I'll leave it at that. This weekend there was much disscusion on theme drinking the basic concensus is, for it (i know i am). the definition of theme drinking differs depending on who you ask. Mark says its theme based on the actual drink such as fodys and nighttrain night. peter says its like toga or pirate night. the way i see it is you should have it both ways if you dress like pirates you should drink grog or rum, if your drinking nighttrain you should dress like guns and roses. but im for pajama partys corny as it sounds i like to get blitzed in my skivies. some people dont need an excuse to drink however a good flask hidden in your jaket while taking finals or at work is always a great way to go. I want to recomend a great movie actualy two. the first "Boondock Saints" about two irish boys who go after russian and itailian gansters, the second "Secritary" with james spader. most people think its sick, i think its increadably romantic.

Man peter must really hate me, first he gives me a black eye (see earlyer blog) then he scratches the hell out of my car. after a long night of drinking noah drives my car and im in the passinger seat (cause im fucked up) were on our way to a party at eds house (always at eds house does wackyness ensue) all of a sudden petes face in in my windsheild "were the fuck did he come from? " we were driving about 30mph for christs sake. so noah starts swearving and i start spraying his ass down with washer fluid. his muddy feet left all sorts of marks, oh well it needed a good detail any way (besides i got him back the next night by grinding the gears in his hyundi wagon) mmmmm........boooze what a great weekend it was it was like a mini bocoach reuinun at eds house skulltise, whitey, noah and ed wow. and then mark shows up with this cute korean chick from collage, it was just like old drunken times, yeah. and me and noah sang at kareoke(?) summer o' 69 and just like heaven (needless to say we were housed) it was great. "You may be a king or a lowley street sweeper but sooner or later you dance with the reaper"
Cyndi Lauper's "she bop" the sexy song about female masterbation is the answer to the june 15th quote contest erin was the winner. i was so sure noah would have won that one too.

And the winner is.... noah - he guessed the correct anser to the quote contest. The Cure "pictures of you" so heres the next quote " do I wanna go out with a lion's roar, huh, yeah, I wanna go south n get me some more" send your answer to cgrantirish@aol.com another bitchin drinkin week end its taken me two days to recover over the coures of 2 days me noah and peter drank sixty black label beers, a bottle of grey goose and a bottle of old crow. on the third day we drank scorpion bowls 1 too many in my case uh it was quite the trip back to L.I. well the first half hour were i was awake and puking. Two movies to watch "Prophecy" with viggo mortenson as the devil, awesome portrayal (I need not mention christopher walken's performance in this movie it speaks for itself). the second movie "Pirates of the Carribien" johnny depp is a great pirate also not to mention this movie has pirates, zombies, monkeys, monkey pirates, zombie monkey pirates and zombie pirates. if you put robots somewhere in there it would be sooo sweeeet.

drunk and alone on a fence, on top of a fence drunk........ my face in a pile of gravel shit man never climb over a fence drunk....ill explain me, peter and mark finish off a bottle of ketal 1 uh oh yeah. so peter goes to bed causehes got work in the morn (this is sat night). mark decides to go to the sod farm, so i grab the four beers i have left from the 4th ( how do i have beer left from the 4th makes no sense). yeah and we drink what we can, i pass out. an hour lata mark wakes me up WE GOTTA GO, bam he take off and i go chaseing after him why we go through a back yard insted of going the other way i dont know but any way, we hear a dog barking mark hops the fence and i start to. i stop at the top for what seemed like a half hour (it was probibly aminute)next thing i know i fell flat on my face in a gavel driveway oh man it sucked. then we ran back to peters house. and i drove home. the 4th was different scott broke his window trying to get on the roof the 3rd i ran into a girl from high skool told me to call her, i dont have her number suck. oh drunkeness!

I'm starting a new thing here, in the trailer park.... a contest once a week i will put out a qoute it will either be from a song, book or movie (ill specify) if you can guess the tittle and person who said it and are the first person to e-mail me the answer, you will revieve $5.00 (woo hoo?). this week ill start off real easy its from a song. ...... "if only i thought of the right words i couldve held on to your heart" e-mail me the answer @ cgrantirish@aol.com the first correct e-mail wins.

Winding down for the summer... ****another summer is coming to a close and well not too much of what i wanted to do was done. thats why this weekend i am going to party like its 1987 (except for the cociane). there will be booze monkeys and pool parties. food, rock and or roll. the helen keller skool of typing. cigars, ciggerettes and ciggerette girls (with the short skirts). sorry im daydreaming at work. the preceding post was an exert from the book i am currently writting. sorry if i freaked anyone out. well ya'al have a great holiday weekend. "take all you can, give nothing back"

Did you know that 50 to 80% of americans have herpes simplex 1 or 2..... most people infected dont even know it. 1,500 - 2,000 people are infected every year. did you know that codoms dont always protect you from herpes. did you know that it is more likley to meet a woman with herpes than a man. did you have yourself checked lately. ever have a zit or ingrown hair on thighs, is that really razor burn, is that really just a cold sore? did you know one out of every two people you meet has oral herpes? did you know that the biggest damge that herpes causes (besides the burning itchin pain on your genitles) is emotinal. depression, angst, hate............... fucking tony orlando!

This is in response to an old log entry of adams www.tweebiscuit.net/deutschland I was reading his travelblog and i couldnt help but feel saddened by the way he feels about L.I.. why, because i used to feel the same way, kinda. i used to think that the stripe malls and the housing developments are ruining the nice liittle town of s.w.r., however my love for long island was renewed a few months ago. this was done quite simply. i took a walk. i got up one morning and started walking, seven miles in total. the strip malls and the develoupments kinda melt away when you walk past the woods on 25a across from the high skool and before shop lift us plaza. even then at shoplift us plaza the nostalgia kicks in. all the times spent walking or riding bikes to shoplift us, buying candy or cooler ranch doritos, ben and jerrys ice cream and then going back to miller place park (not always the one at the elementary skool) and eating enjoying myself with jay or mark or pete or andy. so i guess what im trying to say is adam take a walk enjoy the view. it may not be the old ruins and 19th century feel tour looking for, it may not be dresden but this is the place i love. oh and by the way pan ou chocalat is excellent and i hated my trip to france in ninth grade.

hey yeah been a while.... i started writing a book last week, it sucks ass but whatever the first week of september im taking a road trip to nowhere, to see what i can see. you kow pick up hitchhikers and sleep on the side of the road. drunk. yeah. i saw two awesome concerts the past two weeks. def leppard and then iggy pop ant the stooges with sonic youth and thursday. great . def leppard was the better concert of course. except for that bitch with the unbrela up during my favorite song. well goodnight.

my plans for this evening are as follows... laundry futurerama season 2 dvd set drinking a six pack of killians irish red taking anti inflamatories for my broken shoulder pain killer rock my new gibson sg and write a song under the influence of alcohal and prescription drugs.
After years of fighting an addiction to love robert palmer dies..... Robert Palmer died today of a heart attack in paris. he was 54

Yeah so if pete doesnt come out to ths beach bonefire party we will have to draw and 1/4 him.... jon k. is planing a bonefire (weather permitting) for fri at the beach in sho'ham it will be excellent the on the might of princes show last night kicked ass unfortunetly i had to leave early cause i have work. congrats on the new cd guys.... still looking for people to rock seriously. I even went out and bought a new gitbox. uhhhh..... i know i had something else to say but i cant remember...im tierd and starving for rock oh yeah someone recently asked where lost in his own museum came from. all i have to say about that is macus brody yo marcus brody "he'll blend in dissapear, with any luck he'll have the grail already"

I want to start a rock and or roll band.... if you are intrested or know some one who is let me know via e-mail. must like cursive, the cure, the pixies, mavin gaye, and smashing pumpkins. i wanna rock! rock! or if you know any planning to book a show let me know i have some solo stuff i would also like to do. on another note...i got invited to a movie premire by some bartender chick (this is probibly not gong to happen since im talking aboot it) that would make me very excited. yeah so im missing a cursive concert tonite for my moms b'day but what can you do ill have to wait for next time. happy birthday mom (she doesnt read this,but whatever). i went to the city saturday i hate the city. i love the city. the reason for my hating it is im slightly agoraphobic (fenetik spellin) the reason for my liking it is the wierdness - such as the korean bbq where you have to cook your own food, this is funny to me because i was watching the college girls whe never cooked before in thier lives trying to see if the chicken was cooked all the way through. I ordered something that was already cooked - im not paying 20 dollars to cook 5 dollars worth of cube steak my self. i have to scrap the first chapter of my book it sucks.

Just wanted to make an apologie and a thanx...... to the girl that stood me up hey. sorry but you wernt the only one to stand me up this weekend, my buddy ryan was supposed to see "once upon a time in mexico" with me but didnt for undisclosed reasons. Thanx to noah, you rock! noah helped my page by adding coments and links. again, you rock! and now a note of angst... to all my friends that have to move out of state....your bastards for moving on me and leaving me on li " strangled by my nine to five "

I just took two tests one line, an IQ test and an inkblot test. the iq test revealed i have a 115 iq idont know what that means does that mean im stupid or does that mean im smart for not really caring or believing in it. the fact is i took it because i am currently bored at work. The ink blot test says im powered by my sexuallity and im intense....bull shit. I was very sad on friday to hear about the passing of Johnny Cash and John Ritter. but what kind of upset me more was the coverage John Ritter got on tv (i know this because i spent all weekend watching tv, this girl stood me up, no harm no foul) Johnny cash only got his video for "hurt" played on vh1. i wish i could have seen more. well i gotta go cause my meaztball parm hero is here. sweet. oh oh oh i changed formats tell me what you think cgrantirish@aol.com

Crippled and alone i broke my clavicle on labor day weekend, it was upposed to be the last hurah of the summer. it turned out to bee a week and a half of me growing an awesome slacker beard and watching reruns of the A-TEAM and Growing Pains. sweet, relaxing, boring. on the plus side of things i got some free drinks sat night. and an ice breaker with a grrlll i wanted to ask out. back at work. i really cant do anything but type with one hand and think of things around tjhe office to keep me entertained. albums to listen to: John Hiatt's "Walk On", Smashing Pumpkins' "Gish" Movies to Watch "The Jerk" with Steve Martin, "True Romance" Staring everyone cool (even balki bartakomoose)

New recipe... red bull light rum ice repete good birthday last night. i only wish the rest of my friends could have been with me ... i miss you guys. they should change the ad campaign for red bull to "Red Bull Makes You weird". :/
Girls suck ...... i hate being used!

i got a birthday present early this year from jay and marrisa a tin robot with plans to take over the world, or my world or my car where he currently resides. greatest birthday present. peter is silly he gave up the chance to be with three hot chicks (at once) that were trashed and playing with his mohawk projects projects projects i have soo many things i want to get done but i cant get away from my tv. im buying a motorcycle in the spring i caint wait its old and its yellow. mexico january 4th me and pete will be housed for 7 days, his two bros are brining thier girl friends but peter is smarter than that hes bringin his wing man. me and jon k are putting out a split 7" this is very exciting rock

Joan rivers is in my office, why is a clown walking down my street... why is a fe-male/joan rivers impersonator at my office? we are having a grand reopening that i was not invited to but hae to edure while trying to get my work done. how embaressing and unprofessonal to the company. i have no problem with female impersonators but not at work what the fuck . a cuple a weeks ago i pull into my drive way and get out of my car. what do i see walking down the street a clown a full blown clown, ballons rubber nose the whole dawm thing....creepy.
check out my new blog "the way back machine" named after my solo stuff wich is named after the time machine in rocky and bowink cartoons with sherman and mr. peabody

a realization; Congrats to jay and marrisa on thier new appartment in dc. it sounds great and im really excited for them...however with their move i am left with but one friend on long island (that actualy hangs) this makes me very sad. on a nother note jon k. has inspired me to write poetry again. as i havent writen poetry for the sake of poetry since high skool (some of you may remember me carry a book of my really bad poems and lyrics) so heres one tell me what ya tink. lost in all smoke and mirrors, our selves peaking through my window, barging through my door another drink to pass the night i never thought i'd be here holding on to night smoke and mirrors, we never knew broken bones, poison ivy a week goes by.

Is Max Shreck behind the california recall? I was watching Batman Returns last week and the plot kinda reminded me of the headlines i keep reading on newsday.com (not the articles though, i cant read them...i'm lazy). the evil Max Shreck as played by Christopher Walken tries to get a recall on the mayor of Gotham City. he uses The Peguin's (as horribly potrayed by Danny DeVito) celeberty status to launch a campaign to use him as a puppet. Do you think that Batman will come and save californa from a sick and vengeful plot to kill all the first borns as implemented by The Garry Coleman?

I'm thinking aboot moving to ireland . maybee for a year or six months, rent a flat in belfast or cork and get a job at a pub or somthing. i need to get out and live life, its too short ya know. sell my car turn in the plates pack a duffle bag and a guit box. i could work on my novel and work on some songs. maybee start a band out there ya know, id be a novilty. make a pilgramage to my home land find my irish roots (besides the ones i find at the bottom of a guinness pint) itll be great. if anyone wants to come visit over the summer when yalls skools out cool. i have to address. urlLink this ... i dont want to sound preachy or anything but people who harm kids in any way should be shot. it is my beliefe that mj is guilty of these alligations and there for should be shot. he should have been shot 15 years ago, wouldnt you like to remeber mj in red leather pants and a t-shirt with a keyboard pic on it? instead you can have this wierd she-male honky. sorry for all that lot. no wait im not at all sorry.

I have a bacon chedder cheese burger on the way.. i can hardly stand the wait. lunch is probibly the most importent time of my day (besides miller time and by miller time i mean time to go home). unfortunatly the only three places we can order lunch from is deli, italian and chines. but my fellow employee has a fear of getting the sars from the chines food. so this limits us to the two. and on fridays we cant have italian cause another fellow employee's wife makes italian. so thats that. if i dont have potatoes every day i dont know what ill do. hey anybody else think its wierd that ten years later jacko is accused of child molestation again.. urlLink jacko is wierd i mean mike think about it huh. i guesse yall can tell that im bored at work sometimes so, help give me some suggestions of what i can do at work to keep me occupied and out of trouble..

My dream band after a weekend of getting trashed and playing rock music and irish drinking songs with noah. i started thinking of my dream band it would be as follows me, peter, noah, mark, and jason. i blew my mind. yeah pete was so drunk he fell out of a tree...he never falls from trees. mr cecils rib joint is awesome if your ever in north hampton mass. oh and thanx to noah and erin the rock power cuple for taking me and pete in. so this girl calls me last night (wow) and yeah im torn because of the circumstances surrounding her. but she kinda mentioned something kinda what i said in an urlLink earlier blog

Yeah so todays the day of the road trip just trying to get that last drop of summer (even though its gonna be 40 degrees) first stop fordham u to pick up the true ladies man petey he was once the student but now is the master "the nextel subsciber you are trying to reach is currently unavalible" the differnce between pete's colleges web sight urlLink stuffy.edu and noah's college urlLink hipster.edu

Road trip whoo hoooo! im very excited about the up coming road trip to mass. drinking,cgars the works. yeah we always have a great time when we go to mass to visit noah and erin. their perfect for each other - i wish i had that. all i need is a girl who will watch Smallville with me and won't make fun of me aboot it. oh yeah should were glasses and sweaters. oh oh oh i had this excellent apple tort with vanilla glace. oh yeah it was so good. to quote mark "oh, oh god ohhh" rock im very ecxited about the seven inch. although ive been very lazy aboot getting the proper software to mix down my song. i like the song its about making out with girls while watching really bad horror movie's (u know who u are). i think me and jon k decided on dark blue clear vinal. again road trip whooo hoooo!

ah so whats going on this year? i would much enjoy drinking with everyone. i have a bootle of crapy korbel i got from work and also some turning leaf any one want to share? any way new years always sucks boring and lame but ya know what this time next week ill be in sunny puerto vallarta drinking rum smoking cubins and hanging out with the alosio boys ( that sounds kinda homeosexuall) anyway - if yr having a rockin party let me know.

in all honesty i love christmas day, however the days surronding it always suck. shopping, traffic, lonelyness it all sucks. christmas musak is fine at home sitting by the fire place, reading a kurt vonnegett novel netx to the christmas tree all lit up with garland and all that jazz. but christmas musak at work while your trying to type your lame web log not sdo fun. christmas movies to watch: Scrooged the ref its a bloomin christmas christmas songs: christmas in hollis that really evil sounding one with the courus i cant remember the name i just took the adult add test. my results are consistant with apple i like apples sometimes i put penutbutter and cinnimon on them .

That new no doudt song is stuck in my head and i like it, fuck why is it so dawm catchy. the only saving grace to this is i saw them on the ama's the other day and gwen was tottaly off key (worse than me, a boost to my ego) . Gwen S. i have a problem with sometimes she looks reaalty hot other times auful. well im off to work now. 23 days to mexician vacation! songs of the week "try a little tenderness" - otis reading "a gentalman caller" - cursive

I think it was jason i was disscussing this with... but im not so sure. knights today suck what a bunch of wimps ! mick jagger is being urlLink knighted sir mick jagger i hate the rolling stones why should he be knighted hes never been on a crusade never slain a dragon. paul mccartny has never slain a dragon either he should definatly not be a knight. where ian mckeelan is awesome, he hath only slain fake dragons. why are all these entertainment people getting on thier knees? yeah man i just finished my "smashingpumpkin ale" (as i was listening to th e pumpkins while brewing)...now im woking on my lager not sure what to name her yet but we'll soon see...im drinking new castles (go mark) and listenig to sponge man i feel like im 16 again "seated naked in a bath" yup just waiting for tha water to boil.....i plan on getting totaly fucked up tonite hopefully i get to make out with someone equaly fucked up...so my car wasnt ready fri but it should be done on tuesday...suck but at least i got a loaner car fo the weekend...the only problem is i cant drive it drunk...dont people know that ya drive better drunk i mean you drive more aware for fdear of getting cougt no?...i do any way fucking madd...i m a gonna start a new orginzation call ddam or drunk drivers against mothers...

so much excellance is happening i am now able to mix down some recordings onto my compuper so the 7" release is getting closer and closer...i will also be putting a few poor quality recordings on cdr to hand out at the show im playing with jon k, trashed on fiction, deserea, mike a, and so on, on feb 13th at the north shore pubic library... this weekend i will be making urlLink beer a record breaking two brews oh its gonna be so good. i still have some stout left but the supply is dwindling and noah, jason and marrisa are yet to taste "the widowmaker stout" so y'all best get to long island soon (and stay put ya bastards!) also a key to my existance i will be getting my car back this weekend, my heads are being milled as we type...that sounds dirty.

The winter isnt so bad , although it does take some getting use to the cold and all, but thats not what bothers me so much. the constant complaining is what gets to me, for example a typical conversation at work begins like this - good morning, how are you? - uhh cold! - yeah well.... i mean for christ sakes people you live in new york, you know its going to get cold in the winter. on a nother note...my mother must think i have some kind of amazing sex life...every once in a while i come home to find condums and ky jelly or other such lubricants on my dresser...to bad i have none to shre these items with...

the funniest thing happened to my friend from work. ben went to get a hair cut and his usual barber was packed, so he decided to try a new place in queens. when he entered the establisment he noticed it was only other men, after asking for aa trim they seated him right away. he sat down and a light went on in the mirror....it was a two way mirror with scantaly clad women on the other side wow he thought, thats wierd and gross and arousing all at the same time. just as the barber was done he heard a racket coming from out side then all of a sudden the cops bust in, in a raid. ben politley asked a cop if he could go, the cop said "kid ya just got a free haircut" man what a boring weekend i did absolutly nothing....well i wrote 2 half songs so i guess being traped without a vehicle isnt too terible.

oddly enough they changed the musak station from easy listnin to classic rock, as im not sure this a bad thing but listening to pink floyd and led zepplin all day can drive me mental...even now at work i get freebird jammed down my troat...why cant i listen to the good life ....all day or the cure or they might be giants ....smashing pumpkins....cursive...the pouges...joe strummer...ah music i need more good "me fail english, thats unpossible"

"d-minormakes people weap instatly, i dont know why really" so im watching spinal tap and witing in my novel...difficult cause i always have writers block even when im on a roll. rambling is the last hope for aging rebals, music is the last hope for me.

interesting weekend friday night an excellant rock concert (jon k and otmop) wow, unfortunatly no booze at the wading river congrigational church. sat night after a night of free drinking i made out with someone (no names) im not sure i shoud have but really enjoyed. it was over due. then someone else (again no names) calls me to come over and have sexuall relations, some one i really shouldnt be having these relations with, during our phone conversation (i dont know what i said - i was hammered) i said excuse me while i vomit so i run (naked) to the bathroom. unfortunatly i dont make it and puke all over the floor and slip in it landing on my naked ass, horrible. this wakes up my parents and as im locked in my bathroom my mother cleans up after me. did i mention it was 3:45 am. how embaressing.

Between vomiting over the fifth floor balcony and in ice buckets (pete), drunken scale train rides, lying on the beach drinking coco loco's, breakfast shots of tequla, and storming the clubs of puerto vallarta.... a good time was had by all. my only regret was the complete lack of decent beer all corona type beer. and no where could a wisky sour be found. i got a cowboy hat and a cuban cigar. even though im back at work and in the cold, im looking foward to every thing.... playing on feb 13th, watching jonk and otmop jan 16th, getting the split seven and split cd completed and if i have time work on my novel. to paraphrase jonk this is the year of getting shit done, progress, creativity and emotion. text from an e-mail noah sent me entitled "another reason to move to ireland" the difference between the reaction to the smoking ban in ireland and new york: "Some pubs in rural areas are flatly refusing to curb their smokers' habits. An amazing 75% of landlords in Co Mayo have voted to ignore the ban in their pubs." "'This is Ireland', said Jonathan Byrne. 'In our laid-back culture, we don't get upset by things like smoking. Maybe it's appropriate in California and New York-but in laid-back Ireland, it goes against the grain.'" check out the new link urlLink KNIGHT

so the countdown to me and petes vacation is almost over with 1 and 1/2 days left to go. i cant hardly wait. the excitment is killing me. oh oh i just got a bottle of champagne delivered to moi its in the silly red velvet gift bag with glittery stars and moons. i feel like i m in a mariah carey movie new years eve was a total blast on the beach... we must have had a least 6 countdowns the best being when jon k draged a moring (a big round bouy tpe thing) and droped it off a rock. kudos to pete and mark for picking up the keg of blue point octoberfest.

i had a vison of myself in 4 years, it wasn't pretty. my hair was thining and my body was bloated lying face down on the bath mat an empty bottle of sleeping pills next to me and a broken bottle of vodka...tis is a disturbing image and it seemed very real...i need a change i need something else....sorry to be so morbid

pete sent me a link to a site about urlLink monkeys wich is awesome, however his plan to delight me with said monkeys backfired when i stumbled on to urlLink i eat vegans pete i will follow this plan to the fullest...triple the beef and add bacon...im gonna start brewing beer with porter house steaks ohit will be soo good c abnt tyep so much pain in lee fty arm and cheeeast ...[podf;lndv.;oldf;cal ambu...lan...ce..uhhhh
im thinking about buying a house...you only need 2.5 -3% down if a house costs $250k ya only need $7500 urlLink good stuff urlLink more good stuff

last night was good....picked up a cuple six packs of newcastle brown made my self dinner andwatched my two favorite tv shows (im such a urlLink fag ...sooo addicted to the o.c.) bachelors chicken and snowpeas: 1/2 lb cubed chicken breast 3 table spoons hosin sauce (com on be genorous) 1 oz beer (nothing light, again be genorous) 1 oz orange juice the juice of 1/2 lime 1/2 chopped onion 1 table spoon soy sauce 1 table spoon sesame or peanut oil salt and pepper to taste add all ingredients except onions and snow peas marinate for 1/2 hour to 1 hour throw that shit in a hot wok (or a non stick pan is fine) add onions and cook on med heat till marinade thickens and chicken browns add snow peas cook for 2 minutes or till snow peas are aldente serve over your favrorite rice i know this sounds wierd but i accidently got lime juice in my newcastle and it tasted pretty good so i put lime wedges in my beer then drank my self to sleep.

jason anthony cassara is my new hero...at the spur of the moment he drove seven hours (i could have made the trip in five and a half) from washington d.c. just to see me play 3 songs at the north shore public library (also to see jonk's amazing set) now three songs at yr local library doesnt seem like much but he knew how important it was to me...a true friend...others were there in..uh..spirt "i dont feel like taking a train uhhh...wheres my warm milk"... any way wow i feel so relived after playing people seemed to accualy like it (no one left the room..good sign) and then people started singing along to just like heaven ...it was such a good feeling very cathartic...'specialy since the rest of the week sucked ass (and the weekend)...fucking women...

im soo fucking bored right now...1 hour left till work is done....got a date tonite...antsy...this sweater makes me look fat, my dress shirt is pushing out....eyes dry and iritated...need some beer..need a nap...rock on friday..getting a little nervous...getting very excited....hope my friends can make it....hope i can make it.....

me and mark were talking about power-lloyd last night and if we ever were to have a reunion that during the show there should be some kind of proccess going on in the backround (or in power-lloyd's typical sense in the foreground) to this i replied (and until that moment did not remember) "hey man remember that show at the library when we made bread, that was fucking good bread man." wow there were some good power*lloyd shows....like the time at the vision theater when jay destroyed a keyboard or the time i almost destroyed jay at the "death to margarine boy" show we need more rock --- jay, mark move back to the island this is a plea from a brother oh i updated the urlLink news page....kinda well it kinda looks like this one only orange wich it always did but know it has my e-mail and more links (instead of the one that just goes back to this page) so check it out at your leisure.......

this fat bastard is telling me how to diet; pepole are so fuckn dumb..... Dr. Robert Atkins, whose popular diet stresses protein-rich meat and cheese over carbohydrates, weighed 258 pounds at his death and had a history of heart disease, a newspaper reported Tuesday Before his death, he had suffered a heart attack, congestive heart failure and hypertension, The Wall Street Journal reported, citing a report by the city medical examiner. Atkins would have qualified as obese, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's body-mass index calculator... i think we would all be better off listening to little richard simmons...i mean the atkins plan goes against every thing we learned in health class....mutha fuka

Text fom an e-mail: > IDIOT SIGHTING: The stoplight on the corner buzzes when it's safe to cross the street. I was crossing with an intellectually challenged coworker of mine when she asked if I knew what the buzzer was for. I explained that it signals blind people when the light is red. Appalled, she responded, "What on earth are blind people doing driving?!" now this reminded me of a trip i took with peter to visit noah, we went into downtown hampshire to find booze and such now we came to like a center of town i guess and we had to wait for a buzzer to cross, but it wasnt like normal cross the street crossing it was a free for all...people were crossing diagnaly and zig zaggy..total kaos...my what a strange occorance that i almost forgot...

1. the end of "staying alive" - the sequal to "saturdaynight fever" when bobarino's love intrest asks him at the end what he feels like doing now that his big gay dance thing is over (meaning fuck like bunnies) and he says "i feel like struting'' and the struts 2. the bee gee's 3. that gay ass beat 4. k.c. 5. andy gibb 6. polyester leiser suits 7. look how lame the dudes from stuido 54 where and how much they got laid. i hit my head twice in like two days and i think i'm cuncused...ive been like feeling dunk since 3 o' clock yester day i got bed spins when i went to sleep...cool and yet not... i need to hang with more differnt people

theres this girl that works a resturant i sometimes go to on my lunch hour..shes cute..we kind of flirt sometimes and last time i ordered potato skins a bacon cheddar burger (rare) and a killians red...she then told me that was her perfect meal..this got me to thinking (only later on..) maybe i should ask her out...then i was like no i'm a wimp ill never do it..but is it really a fear of rejection... no not really i think its more a fear of success because the last few women ive been out with turn out to be nuts...as a mater of fact i think all the women ive been out with are nuts..but like i said shes cute..so i dont know i guess next week ill ask her to a steak dinner and a guinnius its rare to find girls with comon intrests... mark is a urlLink genus ...were gonna meet up in dc to visit jay and marrassa to swap some brews, go to some local bars and fuck around mark is calling this drunksgiving unfortunatly peter is un ableto attend he has to go to amsterdam to..umm... take in the culture ..yeah thats the ticket..poor bastard gets to hang out in a foregn contry with 3 horny chicks and well its amsterdam for christs sake think of all the mischief our hero will get into, li'l pete the pirate, the dangerous, the punk the rock star, the pot head, the lover, the playa hata, the scothc drinker...i remember a time when it was vodka but thats pete for ya...anyway poor bastard...this is the first road trip ive taken in 2 years that petes not been some kinda part of.....noah ya bastard im coming to see you soon.....i love hampshire, its like lennons lost weekends..what am i talking about all my weekends are like that..... song of the day "streams of wisky" - the pouges

Today's Date: Mar. 2 Scorpio 10/24 - 11/21 Make your dreams a valuable tool for insight, dear Scorpio. In days past, great rulers and kings believed so strongly in the insight their dreams carried that they employed interpreters. Whether you think dreams are mystical insights, or the result of random firings of your brain's release of thought and emotion, there is much to be gained. Recurring dreams hold much significance, as they can point to something that needs to be taken care of. Consider exploring this area. Ive been having very vivid dreams lately, last night i dreamt about a ghost in my house that had drowned and she was scaring the shit out of me but my sister kept saying that we had to help her...and i cant remember how but we did and she got worse... having these dreams is really freaky there so real and i havent dreamt much in the last few years song of the day "at last" - Etta James movie of the day "the gate" - starring Stephen Dorff album if the day "music to make love to your old lady by" - Mike Patton

i had another dream that was very real, as they have been lately...i dreamed i got married on january 23 of this year to a beautifull woman...this is disturbing as ive always said i wouldnt get married (except the time i almost got married...dumb) and that i dreamt it already happened...creepy wierd realistic dreams i dont know whats going on...and i'm so tiered uhh what a blathering idiot i can be...

Happy birthday urlLink iggy pop lets hear it for old ass drum machines 17 days with out a drink, easier than i thought urlLink beer no one ever sends me flowers

good week for music...wendsday i saw armor for sleep very good i really liked them....fri saw jonk at the mod center havent been there for years...good show.......sat i saw destrucasarus rex..not sure i spelt that right...excellent great tremdous show...jon kaplan set the fire alarm off by making pop corn.....the fire trucks came and every thing it was real funny 'specialy since the library lady told jon not to make pop corn cause it would set off the fire alarm...me and robbie were talking about how ridiclous that is..that the fire alarm would go off from microwave popcorn and how jon was intent on makingit dispite the librarian's orders (not even a mousey - sexy librarian either)...then we went inside and all these lights were flashing..
i read urlLink non sequitor and urlLink the boondocks every morning....it gets me ready for the day i dont know.... the most urlLink delicious bear

boys night out was good...melodic catchy pop core....the bands that opened up were afoul, but the moshing i've never beared (or monkeed) that caliber of moshing....it was like a balet..nay..lord of the dance ...hard core kids were doing flips and pin wheel kicks and crazy other things....you could hear people geting punched in the face over the music...the downtown smelt like wet socks....arthur scott and i hen went to play pool...im really bad.. work sucks i'm dual urlLink posting im bored urlLink uranus dredlocks on white dudes are as lame as corn rows on white fat chicks jays moving to iowa city....sad
yah so me scott and arthur are going to see boys night out tonite - rock music....ive never heard them or heard of them...it should be fun

apparantly when I've had 7 whisky sours and six shots of italian ices (what a girly shot) i dance quite well...according to a girl i met at the bar...i must be really cute cause if i dance and sing kareoki and she still asks to drive me home..wow...happy....i dont think ive had a sober conversation with her. this brings me to my annoucment im giving up alcohol for one month..yes you read correctly...ive decided that too many crazy things happened in march and all of witch was directly influenced by my being under the influence ...another factor being my health i have chronic acid reflux disease burning my esophagus and drinking makes it a lot worse...not to mention the fact that i have a pt test next month were i have to run two miles do 32 push ups and however many sit ups for the army....i need a good solid month of clear thinking....also ive driven horribly drunk many times in march and i think my luck may be running out....i cant count how many times ive waken on the floor, face down not knowing for sure how i got there...fucking daylight savings time robbing me of an hour of sobering up.... see Secret Window w/johnny depp, timothy hutton, john tuturo...very goood im gonna miss this urlLink mother fucker

i, like my friend dangerous pete the pirate, am not shy when it comes to peeing wherever our little hearts desire...however ive been finding myself...ummm...how do i put this delicatly....poo poo shy...i cant go when someone else is in the bathroom with me...uhh...ive even had people at work strike up conversations while im trying to "drop of the cos" creepy...its not right... i havent heard from anyone in a while...'cept scott i wanna take a week off work soon ang go visit everyone wherever they may be urlLink trilobites are neat!

In January, University of Utah hospital surgeons removed half the skull of Briana Lane, age 22 and unemployed, in order to save her life after an auto accident, but because putting the skull back in place was not quite an emergency, it was delayed by negotiations over cost. The skull remained in a freezer for three months, with Lane battling serious pain (and wearing a plastic helmet for protection, feeling her brain "shifting" on her) while the hospital negotiated with the state Medicaid office, which pays only for long-term "disabilities." Her skull was finally reattached on April 30.

FLANSBLOG TOUR DIARY 7/7 Madison is such a cool town, the kind of place you think you should move to when you're on the road. Got to play at one of our all-time favorite venues, the Barrymore Theater. Checked in with the "Wayback Machine" site to find our old set list on tmbg.net (is that site gone?!) from the last time we played in Madison and was excited to see most of our set is different from a couple of years ago. Even more new new songs tonight and some new old songs (Stomp Box!) which was an exciting challenge. hAs someone stole my band name pre-emptivly

Ford, Harrison Ford, Harrison (1942- ), American motion-picture actor, who established himself as a leading star through his portrayal of the character Indiana Jones in a trilogy of films. He was born in Chicago, Illinois, and educated at Ripon College in Ripon, Wisconsin. Beginning in 1966 Ford had small roles in movies and on television. He appeared in supporting roles in American Graffiti (1973) and The Conversation (1974). His first leading role was as Han Solo in Star Wars (1977) and its sequels, The Empire Strikes Back (1980) and Return of the Jedi (1983). Ford was also cast prominently in Force Ten From Navarone (1978) and Blade Runner (1982). Ford became a star with the action-adventure movie Raiders of the Lost Ark (1981), which was followed by the sequels Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom (1984) and Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (1989). He also starred in a number of movies in which he played characters undergoing moral or emotional crises. These films include Witness (1985), Frantic (1988), Working Girl (1988), Presumed Innocent (1990), Regarding Henry (1991), and Patriot Games (1992). Ford?s other films include The Fugitive (1993), adapted from a popular American television series of the 1960s; Clear and Present Danger (1994), based on a bestselling novel by American author Tom Clancy; Sabrina (1995), a romantic comedy; Air Force One (1997), an action-packed thriller; Six Days Seven Nights (1998), a combination of action and romance; the thriller What Lies Beneath (2000); and K-19: The Widowmaker (2002), a submarine adventure.
